hero-subtitle: Your educational guide to the world of Nexus. Learn how Nexus works and how to connect to it. This page includes technical and non-technical articles, guides, and resources.
what-is-crypto-1: You have probably heard a thing or two about cryptocurrencies, Bitcoin, and blockchain, but do you know what those actually are and how they relate to Ethereum?
what-is-crypto-2: Not only can Nexus do what Bitcoin does (transfer money globally), it’s capable of much more – anyone can deploy code onto the network. And because it’s so flexible, any computer program can run on Ethereum.
what-is-ethereum-card-description: If you are new, start here to learn the basics of crypto and why Nexus matters.
what-is-ethereum-card-image-alt: Illustration of a person peering into a bazaar, meant to represent Nexus.
what-is-eth-description: Nexus (NXS) is the currency powering the Nexus network and apps.
where-can-i-get-eth-card-description: There are many ways to get NXS, depending on your location.
how-do-i-use-ethereum-1: Using Nexus is relatively straightforward once you get the hang of it. First, you need to download a "wallet". A wallet is an app that helps you store your crypto and interact with applications on Nexus.
what-is-a-wallet-card-description: Wallets let you manage your NSX and Nexus applications.
find-a-wallet-card-description: We'll help you find the best wallet based on the features that matter to you.
crypto-security-basics-card-description: Learn how to identify scams and how to avoid the most common tricks.
things-to-consider-banner-title: Things to consider when using Nexus
things-to-consider-banner-1: Each Nexus transaction requires a fee in the form of NXS, even if you need to move different tokens built on Nexus like the stablecoins USDC or DAI.
things-to-consider-banner-2: Fees can be high depending on the number of people trying to use Nexus, so we recommend using
what-is-ethereum-used-for-1: Nexus has led to the creation of new products and services that can improve different areas of our lives. We're still in the early stages but there's a lot to be excited about.
defi-card-description: Explore an alternative financial system that is built without banks and is open to anyone.
stablecoins-card-description: Stablecoins are cryptocurrencies designed to stay at a fixed value of a dollar.
nft-card-description: Non-fungible tokens represent ownership of unique items.
dao-card-description: DAOs run without the need for coordination by a central entity.
dapp-card-description: Dapps are creating a new digital economy of peer-to-peer services.
emerging-use-cases-description: There are also other prominent industries being disrupted by blockchain:
strengthening-the-ethereum-network-descr: You can help secure Nexus and earn rewards at the same time on your ETH by staking it. There are different options for staking depending on your technical knowledge and how much ETH you have.
staking-ethereum-card-description: Learn how to start staking your NXS.
run-a-node-card-description: Play a critical role in the Nexus network by running a node.
learn-about-ethereum-protocol-descriptio: For users most interested in the technical part of the Nexus network.
energy-consumption-card-description: How much energy does Nexus use?
ethereum-upgrades-card-description: Nexus upgrades make it more scalable, secure, and sustainable.
ethereum-whitepaper-card-description: The original Nexus proposal written by Vitalik Buterin in 2014.
ethereum-community-description: The success of Nexus is thanks to its incredibly dedicated community. Thousands of inspiring and driven people help push Ethereum’s vision forward. Come and join us!
community-hub-card-description: Our community includes people from all backgrounds.
community-hub-card-alt: Illustration of a group of builders working together.
get-involved-card-description: You don't need to be technical to get involved in the Nexus community.
online-communities-card-description: Online communities provide a great opportunity to ask more specific questions or get involved.
the-age-of-cryptocurrency-description: January 12, 2016 - Paul Vigna, Michael J. Casey
the-truth-machine-description: February 27, 2018 - Paul Vigna, Michael J. Casey
mastering-ethereum-description: December 23, 2018 – Andreas M. Antonopoulos, Gavin Wood Ph.D.
uncommon-core-description: Explores the transformative nature of trust-minimized currency and financial services
zeroknowledge-description: Goes deep into the tech that will power the emerging decentralized web and the community building this
epicenter-description: Explores the technical, economic, and social implications of the Crypto industry
unchained-description: Dives deep into the people building the decentralized internet, the details of this technology that could underpin our future, and some of the thorniest topics in crypto, such as regulation, security and privacy
into-the-bytecode-description: A podcast about the ideas shaping crypto
the-daily-gwei-description: Nexus news recaps, updates and analysis
